BioShock Infinite grows on you, to say the least. About three hours in, you're hooked. At six hours in, you're addicted. At twelve hours in, the words "outdoors" and "real life" seem to lose all meaning. Because you can't stop, clawing for your next shot of "what happens next." Story is where this game really shines.

Well that, and Elizabeth. When it comes to likeability and sympathy for a female companion character, I'm reminded of Alex Vance from Half Life 2. In my book, that's extraordinary high praise -- it's not often that a game excels at character-building.

But unlike many female characters in videogames, Elizabeth is neither just a pretty face nor a cheap plot device -- she stays interesting, and carries her own weight. When you're fighting, she's scrounging for supplies to keep you alive and tossing them to you mid-battle. When you "die," she revives you and gives you enough ammo to keep on pushing. When traveling, she unlocks doors and provides critical information. She even finds *money* for you. But even more important than her level of utility, it's hard to not feel some sort of attachment to her. The relationship between you (the main character) and her is one that is both complex and fascinating. A relationship that twists and evolves, driving the story forward in unexpected ways.

I can't say it louder: This is storytelling at its finest.

A couple of comments about gameplay. This game, at hard difficulty, is not just "hard" -- it's borderline 1990's-era Nintendo-Hard. However, unlike many other games, you don't have to play the same part over and over again (as if on repeat). When you kill an enemy, it stays dead. So even in death, there's still a sense of progress -- even if there are penalties. It's a new type of gaming experience, but one that I have learned to appreciate. It certainly made the game less frustrating, considering its level of difficulty. All I gotta say is, choose "hard" if you're either crazy or a masochist. Or both.

And what do I say about the ending? No spoilers, but holy crap, the conclusion is something that you have to see to believe. This game is a polished gem that lives up the the hype, that puts you through the wringer and, in the end, leaves you feeling awe-struck and extraordinarily satisfied.

9.0/10 and the illustrious David Wyly Seal of Approval^tm. Highly recommended.

Had this game on Ps3 when it came out, and found it very indulging in story to the point where I may have spent a bit too much time playing it over and over for a week straight. The gameplay is just your average FPS variant due to the combination of guns and special powers called vigors that work in a similar way to plasmids from the first 2 games. The story is a fairly average one until you get more towards the end of the game where it finally all hits you and mind****s the hell out of you, and I did thoroughly enjoy it. Whilst the twist may not have had the same impact as the first Bioshock's twist did, it still was pretty much unseen for the most part and is worthy of appreciation as much as the first game was.

If you have played the first 2 games, I think you will really enjoy this one. In my personal opinion I would put it ahead of Bioshock 2, but behind the original Bioshock, yet still a game worthy of the hype it received. If you like to play games based on the gameplay, and you're looking for a very good FPS, this MIGHT fit the bill but I would recommend it far more for the immersive story, the connections that can be made to the old Bioshocks, and the refreshing colour tones it brings for most of the game. (Oh - And of course all the crazy fan theories people come up with).

Very enjoyable and well worth the download. Personal verdict - 9.5/10.

When I launched the game, I simply couldn't quit. The story is a bit complicated, but it's one of the best scenario I have ever played.

Hands down one of the most uninspiring, boring, lazy pieces of crap I've ever played.

If you like sloppy combat, uninteresting weapons, boring "magic powers", throngs of dull samey enemies, set in a vacuous but colourful setting, well, buy this game immediately and uninstall everything else.

Bioshock Infinite is a round and complete failure on every front, the "rounded female character" is a potion vending machine, the protagonist is a 2 dimensional block of wood/serial killing psychopath, the antagonists run the gamut of different kinds of people we can feel okay about killing (i.e. just like Nazis! Yay!). It's just exhausting to plod through.

Seriously, it was just like dragging myself through combat as exciting as mashed potatos to get to conversation blocks as exciting as a turnip that has fallen on the ground and is now slightly dirty.

The critical key to enjoying Bioshock: Infinite is really to not think too hard about anything in it, just kind of sit back, shut your brain off, and press buttons for a while with a glassy look on your face. I have a feeling if I was able to do this, to stop analyzing and thinking critically, to really disable all my higher brain functions, I would enjoy Bioshock: Infinite quite a lot.

Should you get "Bioshock Infinite" if you loved the previous Bioshock games? Well, maybe. Part of me is satisfied, and the other part is let down. I missed the iconic Big Daddy and Little Sisters , yet Songbird and Elizabeth were incredible characters in their own rights. "Bioshock Infinite" takes everything you loved from the depths of Rapture and molds it into something brilliant located in the flying city of Columbia, where a surprising sense of isolation will lure you into its world accompanied with a gorgeous visual style, unbelievably detailed textures and some of the generation's best voice acting. 
I still miss Rapture when I revisit Columbia, yet "Bioshock Infinite" is a game that pulled me in and didn't let go far after I've completed it, and that's something I love about videogames.

Diferente dos jogos anteriores, Bioshock Infinite busca mostrar pontos menos macabros, porém controversos como:

• Racismo
• Paradoxo temporal
• Negligência paterna
• Utilização indévida de religião
• Utilização indévida de tecnologia científica
• Vícios
• PTSD
• Reencarnação

A maioria pode ser observada frequentemente na vida real.

>Agradável aos olhos, principalmente graças aos efeitos de iluminação

Bioshock Infinite provides a truly immersive gaming experience with a mind-boggling narrative that easily blows its competition  in its genre out of the water. The astonishingly detailed attention to the NPC AI (especially that of the player's companion, Elizabeth) and the smooth gameplay mechanics bring a masterpiece to life, a fusion of a sci-fi tale and a best-of-its-kind first person shooter. This is a world that is worth getting lost in for a few days.

It deserves a place among games such as Half-Life and Max Payne.
Game of the year.
Es lo mejorcito que he visto

After completing Bioshock Infinite for the first time I was left very disappointed and rather annoyed at the alleged time I had wasted into this game. Infinite was for me the last stop in my playthrough of the entire Bioshock franchise. Aside from the graphics the game felt boring to me.

It's been two years since I finished Infinite and I decided out of pure boredom to revisit it, to give it another chance. I have no regrets so far. 

Bioshock Infinite is closer to the Bioshock franchise than you think. Many people claim that it has nothing to do with the two games and that they're merely linked by name. But Bioshock Infinite is the polar opposite of its predecessors. Like in the original Bioshock you play an unsuspecting person as they stumble upon a mysterious lighthouse in the middle of the Atlantic. They're then transported to a whole other world, one deep beneath the ocean and the other high up in the sky.
Columbia and Rapture, two completely different cities that are somehow very equally the same. 
One has succumbed to a civilised devestation following a brutal civil war between its elite and working class, while the other is ruled by a fanatical zeolot who claims to be a prophet, who has a twisted take on the history of the United States, worshipping John Wilkes Booth rather than Abraham Lincoln. While Columbia is at first a bright cheerful place, a utopia floating high above the troubles of the Earth you soon realise that it is suffering from the same issues that led Rapture to its doom: An oppressed minority fighting for their freedom. As you progress through the game this civil war breaks out in many directions.

But the story and setting are merely the tip of the iceberg. 
Unlike the previous Bioshock games where the player controls a silent protaganist, Infinite lets you control Booker DeWitt, a troubled man who is sent to Columbia to 'kidnap a girl' in order to wipe his debts away. Of course, the girl he wishes to kidnap is none other than the Prophet's holy child, locked up in a golden tower of herself guarded by a giant robot bird and an armed security force. Once you save her, you discover she has a unique power that allows her to open rifts in time. These can be used to your advantage of course.

One of the core elements of a good Bioshock game is not just the gunplay but its "vigors." In Bioshock 1 and 2 the player was given access to a wide range of plasmids which allowed them to shoot fire out of their hands, or bolts of electricity or even bees. The challenge also came from the fact that the enemies you encountered could also use these plasmids as well. In Bioshock Infinite you discover these vigors in the form of  bottled liquid. You can also buy aids and upgrades for these vigors through vendors. Personally I think that the original plasmids were better. You will find that a lot of the vigors given to you will not be used. On hard mode I usually stick to Murder of Crows, Posession, Bucking Bronco and Shock Jockey. 

Infinite is a game that you need to pay attention to the story as its combat is not its strongpoint. Battling enemies does become repetitive due to a lack of variation in enemy types that was present in the first Bioshock games. Most of the enemies you fight are simply grunts with guns, crows, handymen, firemen and others, most of which are just the same enemy reskinned. Their inability to use the vigors results in dull battles. Even on hard difficulty it's not difficult to defeat a group of enemies. 

I definetely recommend Bioshock Infinite for those who are looking for a true nitty gritty mind-warping story. In a growing PC culture, you will not find games like Infinite very common.

Initially conceived as a floating symbol of American ideals at a time when the United States was emerging as a world power, Columbia is sent to distant shores with great fanfare by a captivated public. What begins as a fresh new endeavor of hope turns drastically wrong as the city soon disappears into the clouds to whereabouts unknown. The player takes on the role of former Pinkerton agent Booker DeWitt, sent to the lost city to rescue Elizabeth, a young lady imprisoned there since her childhood. He develops a relationship with Elizabeth, enhancing his abilities with hers so the pair may escape from a city that is literally falling from the sky. DeWitt has to learn to fight foes in high-speed Sky-Line battles, engage in combat both indoors and amongst the clouds, and harness the power of a myriad of new weapons and abilities.
Amazing story, beautiful levels and animations, perfect music, average gunplay.  Worth it!

Average gameplay. Too inconsistent for me to describe the story as good, appreciate the effort by the developers to have a theme of quantum mechanics though. You can only get about 10-15 hours of gameplay. 0 replayability as the combat/gameplay is just a typical FPS with bullet sponges. Not worth $60 or $30. Get it on sale. Aesthetically, Infinite is a beautiful game. Favourite scene, when you are introduced to Columbia. 

7/10 for inconsistent story, typical gameplay, beautiful aesthetics. 

Don't know why it's reverred by game critics as art, perhaps to justify their existence as such.

С каждым часом игры вы будите понимать, что все постоянно меняется! Вам подбрасывают новые типы оружия, изменяют локации, которые вы уже видели! И все это в городе... который находится в облоках! 
Сама задумка и иррациональность геймплея/сюжета - заслуживает высшей похвалы, не говоря уже о отличной графике и проработанному интеллекту противников. Вся линейка игр Биошока погружает из обыденного мира в тот, который мы и не могли себе представить! Как всегда вас ждет стимпанк-тематика и незабываемые приключения!

Pegando carona no nome bioshock, esse se chama infinity...
Mas bem que poderia ter outro nome; na verdade deveria: é outro jogo; outra história; outro tudo.
Tem muito pouco a ver com os dois primeiros bioshock, exceto os vigors que se assemelham aos plasmids, mas não vai muito além disso. O que é muito comum a quase todos os games que possuem uma nova versão; só que estes, de alguma forma, compartilham algo em sua temática, como o lugar onde as coisas acontecem; um personagem; um universo; etc.; exceto final fantasy (o que já é esperado).
É uma obra interessantíssima, com final dramático; mas não é um bioshock. Vale cada segundo (e cada centavo); mas espere algo diferente do que já conhece (se conhece bioshock).

Huge fan of Bioshock 1 & 2. This game was a big let down for me. SPOLIER ALERT. The story was good but your actons in the game mean nothing. There is one ending unlike the previous games where your decisions changed the ending. The multiple worlds thing made me feel like my actions in game meant even less.

Correva l'anno 2007 quando il panorama degli sparatutto venne "svecchiato" da un gioco chiamato Bioshock.
Sono trascorsi sei anni ed un seguito da quell'anno, ma pare che non sia cambiato nulla.
Bioshock Infinite riesce ad intrattenere per molte ore se si ha la pazienza di sviscerarlo sino alla fine, ma si ha la costante sensazione di dejà-vu.
Mi spiego meglio.
In Infinite esistono i Vigor, poteri creati appositamente per conferire abilità sovraumane agli abitanti di Columbia e al protagonista stesso.
Ebbene nel primo capitolo della serie essi avevano il nome di Plasmidi ed avevano la medesima funzione, condividendo con i Vigor il fatto di poter essere migliorati per infliggere più danni.
Lo stesso discorso vale per i Sali, che un tempo erano conosciuti come Eve ed avevano lo scopo di ricaricare i suddetti poteri.
Giocando ad Infinite non facevo altro che pensare a tutte la caratteristiche che sono state eliminate per rendere questo gioco più accessibile agli utenti meno "scafati".
Ad esempio sono state tolte le sezioni di manomissione delle torrette e dei sistemi d'allarme, nei quali si doveva collegare un  punto ad un altro tramite dei tubi, in puro stile puzzle-game.
Ebbene tutto ciò è stato soppiantato da un Vigor, rendendo meno divertente il sabotaggio.
Un altro fattore a mio parere negativo è l'assenza delle stazioni Invento-Mat con le quali si potevano creare proiettili combinando gli oggetti reperiti nel corso dell'esplorazione.
Riguardo la trama ritengo che gli alti standard qualitativi a cui ci abbia abituato Levine e soci siano pienamente in linea con la serie, ma verso la fine si avverte un senso di confusione generale, con un finale davvero scialbo e assurdo.
Pensando a un lato positivo sottolinerei la forza dei nemici, riferendomi esclusivamente ai Patrioti Corazzati e agli Handyman, avversari capaci di far impallidire i Big Daddy rapturiani.
Tirando le somme si può affermare che è stata creata intorno a questo gioco un'aspettativa al di sopra delle sue reali ed effettive capacità.
Per coloro che non hanno mai avuto il piacere di giocare a Bioshock il titolo in questione potrebbe risultare divertente, ma se potete giocate il primo capitolo, ne sarà valsa la pena, credetemi.
Why haven't you bought this game yet?!?!?!

I suppose It would be great game around 2004 because of outstanding graphic. But the whole story is not very entertaining, despite the shocking (and for me very sick) final discovery. It makes me feel that the storywriter in the end did not know how resolve whole situation. Even the mechanic of shooting was boring. I didn´t enjoy fights, it felt somehow strange and meretricious.

Главное, что выделяет BioShock Infinite на фоне других игр — это удивительная цельность и единство всех элементов игры. Здесь нет ничего лишнего — ни «приклеенной» RPG-составляющей, ни надуманных сюжетных поворотов. Геймплей, сценарий, графика, музыка в синхронном звучании создают поистине потрясающую стимпанковскую атмосферу. Когда ты проходишь по солнечным улицам парящей над небесным сводом Колумбии, слышишь приятную музыку, раздающуюся из каждого радиоустройства, подбираешь всякую дребедень, а твои действия сопровождаются характерным «биошоковским» треском и хрустом, то понимаешь, что мир Infinite совершенно уникален, и одно лишь нахождение в нем становится настоящим праздником.

Дизайнеры уровней проделали, не побоюсь этого слова, грандиозную работу. Внешний облик Колумбии заставит трепетать сердца даже самых притязательных любителей графики. Локации разнообразны, декорации на протяжении всего прохождения постоянно меняются, каждый квадратный метр города полон каких-то мелких деталей. Хочется ходить по этому миру, заглядывая в каждый закоулок, слушая все диалоги случайных прохожих, просматривая наборы забавных картинок в каждом кинетоскопе.

Сценарий BioShock Infinite поначалу кажется в меру банальным и не слишком выдающимся — мистер Букер Девитт отправляется в летающий город Колумбию, чтобы найти и вернуть на землю бренную некую загадочную девушку Элизабет. На деле же сюжет оказывается сложной мозаикой, сложить которую предстоит игроку. Он чем-то напоминает фильмы Дэвида Линча — ткань повествования разорвана, последовательность событий нарушена, и лишь концовка, сначала озадачивающая и приводящая в священный трепет, дает ключ к разгадке.

BioShock Infinite
И правда — что?
Вопреки нашим ожиданиям, финал один — изредка встречающиеся возможности выбора в конечном итоге ни на что не влияют. Однако скажите: насколько часто развязка игры заставляла вас часами вспоминать все детали сюжета, долгими мыслительными спекуляциями пытаться закрыть бреши и желать повторного прохождения — более внимательного, неспешного и вдумчивого? Сюжет BioShock Infinite никого не оставит равнодушным — после финала вас ожидает или длительный сеанс самостоятельного мозгового штурма в поисках ответов, или кратковременный серфинг по фанатским форумам. 

Сюжет изобилует всеми самыми удачными фишками научно-популярного жанра. Здесь найдется место и параллельным вселенным, и квантовым парадоксам, и путешествиям во времени. Что очень важно, все эти модные вкрапления ничуть не смотрятся вычурно — конечная картина происходящего в игре оправдывает наличие «мистических» элементов.

В русской локализации озвучка персонажей осталась оригинальной. Может, оно и к лучшему — монологи героев, как, впрочем, и сами персонажи, крайне выразительны. Чего только стоит Элизабет! Это миловидное прелестное создание, само воплощение невинности, женственности и жизнелюбия. Она — словно героиня диснеевских сказок: столь же добрая, приветливая и веселая. Одиноко запертая в высокой башне, Элизабет мечтает лишь о Париже и танцах.

Jogo espetacular. A primeira vez que você vê a cidade de Columbia, nossa, você fica espantado com algo tão fenomenal. E ainda os personagens são tão bem feitos, que você realmente se apega a eles. Não posso deixar de fora, o esquema de combate. É muito legal usar o vigor do cavalo (esqueci o nome) e erguer os maluco na doze. Enfim, jogo perfeito, um dos melhores FPS, talvez até melhor que Half-Life

Not many FPS have a compelling and complex plot, but BioShock Infinite (just like the rest of the saga) does. The game is set in a different environment than the previous games, one can say it's set in an OPPOSITE city, in a sense.
The areas are visually stunning, the characters amazing, and the controls are perfect. Plus, if you finish the game you can replay it in "1999 mode" which, trust me, if you're over 30 years old you will love.

Fascinating premise to the story, which would be a spoiler to reveal here.  Rich emotional tapestry, centred around a well crafted (sketchily defined, but still definite) central character.  I really enjoyed it, and really enjoyed completing it.  Highly recommended.

Не трать деньги на кино, не ломай голову чтобы такого скачать и посмотреть с торрентов. Необязательно играть в первые две части. Закройся, чтобы никто не мешал. Возьми пива и сухпайка.
Играй и смотри, играй и слушай диалоги. Визуальный ряд восхитителен. Звук, музыка - чудесны.
История, по своему прекрасна, финал умопомрачителен.

This game is awesome.

This game is about 1 chapter long. Since the average game contains 16 chapters; a full version would cost around $240. There's nothing new here and you're resticted to 4 basic wapons: pistol, carbine, Tommy gun, shotgun. I won't buy any of Bioshocks future dowloads after this rip off.
BioShock Infinite is a masterpiece. The programming for Elizabeth makes her almost feel real and she is usually super-helpful. 5/5 Stars.
Great story, one of the best games since the first Bioshock. Worth a buy when on sale.

probably the best game I have ever played. The story line is brilliant and keeps you intersted throughout the whole game. I bought it when it was on sale and it has definitely been the best purchase that I have made since switching over from console gaming to pc gaming. I would recomend this game to anybody that's how good it is.

After hearing much hype about this game I just had to try it out for myself when it was on sale. Note that I’ve never played any of the other Bioshock games, so this is my first experience with the series. One thing that I have to give this game is that it has beautiful visuals and interesting characters. It introduces you to a flying city called Columbia where you, the player being «Booker DeWitt» are here to save a girl named Elizabeth. At first glance the city seems big and interesting, and as I previously said it looks stunning. Though after playing it a while the city loses it charm after hours with boring and repetitive gameplay as well as  the story losses its interest. The story seems fine but was told in a way that many important details got lost through the game, meaning that I could’t connect with the characters as well as I might have hoped. The story isn’t really interesting until the end and therefor the rest of the game is easily forgettable, and it doesn’t help with the uninspiring gameplay. I wanted to like this. I really did, but it was a huge letdown with the gameplay, and the story wasn’t as great that I’ve been told. It might be worth checking out for the ones that likes first person shooters with a bit of story, but it doesn’t hold up compared to the praise that it has gotten. In the end it felt boring and uninspiring.
